item.title: COGC009733 LG314/411/20/020 - Management of the Surfers Paradise Beachfront Markets
item.description:
The scope of the contract is for the provision of services to plan, manage and deliver the Surfers Paradise Beachfront Markets (SPBM) from 1 July 2020.  The Contractor must be available for handover including shadowing current SPBM staff from 1 June 2020.

The SPBM operate every Wednesday, Friday and Sunday, excluding Queensland Schoolies Week (generally the third week of November) and Christmas Day if it falls on an operating day.  No other Public Holiday closures apply.

The regular SPBM operate along the foreshore of Surfers Paradise Beach between View Avenue and Hanlan Street.  If required, the SPBM can extend from View Avenue to Trickett Street.  Circumstances where this may be required include when accommodating for higher stallholder numbers, if SPBM need to be relocated due to a major event or in the case of inclement weather.

Trading hours are in Queensland Time:

- 4pm to 9pm during June and July
- 5pm to 10pm from August to May

A maximum of 200 stalls are permitted per night. No food trucks or ready to eat onsite prepared food stalls are permitted.
item.category: 80000000 Management and Business Professionals and Administrative Services

item.title: GRC009728 227-20 Construction of Kirkwood Road and Dixon Drive Signalised Intersection
item.description:
The intersection of Kirkwood Road and Dixon Drive is currently an un-signalised “T” Intersection.


Kirkwood Road is an arterial road with an AADT of approximately 10,000vpd that links the Eastern approach to Gladstone at Gladstone-Benaraby Road and the Dawson Highway to the north and west. It plays an integral part in the heavy vehicle distribution to Gladstone industry.


There has been a recorded crash history at the intersection and design models indicate the intersection has reached its design capacity.


As a result, Gladstone Regional Council (‘GRC) identified the intersection as unsafe and nominated to signalise the intersection to improve its safety and performance for the Gladstone community.
This project is undertaken as an external contract and seeks to implement the issued for construction signalised intersection design as part of the Council’s operating objectives.
item.dc:creator: Gladstone Regional Council
item.dc:subject: 46161500 Traffic control
46161504 Traffic signals

item.title: CHRC009747 Flood Totem Seating – Botanic Gardens, Emerald
item.description:
Central Highlands Regional Council (CHRC) wish to install iconic flood totems in the Emerald Botanic Gardens. These totems will acknowledge the three highest recorded flood levels, give people perspective on the height of the floods, and serve as a tourist attraction.

The flood totems will incorporate architecturally designed, bespoke public seating and visually highlight the flood date and height encountered during these three flooding events.

This Contract is for the construction of the iconic flood totems in up to three sites within the Emerald Botanic Gardens.

item.title: GRC009672 27-20 Provision of Multi-Functional Devices and related services
item.description:
Gladstone Regional Council requires to enter an operational rental / lease agreement for up to five (5) years for the supply, servicing and running costs of multi-functional devices (MFD).

This tender is for the staged provision of standardized multifunction devices to replace an existing and aging fleet as well as new devices as required for up to five (5) years. The services shall include the provision of:

  • various MFDs and Printers (capacity for photocopying, printing, scanning and/or faxing);
  • a warranty and support service (including full maintenance);
  • a cost per click rate;
  • a pro-active toner and ink supply service, including delivery to site;
  • a recycling service for empty toner cartridges (including return/collection of empty and waste toner cartridges for all devices (i.e MFDs, laser jet printers and other devices within Council) or recycling);
  • a simple, transparent invoicing model;
  • a central help desk facility;
  • a proactive dynamic monitoring of MFD components life cycles and error messages; and
  • end of contract equipment removal.

  1. The Awoonga Lake rail trail (36.28 kilometres);
  2. The Kalpowar Tunnels Rail Trail (31.2 kilometres); and
  3. The Burnett River Bridges Rail Trail (28.8 kilometres).

item.title: CHRC009759 Emerald Airport Terminal Redevelopment
item.description:
The Emerald Airport terminal building has been extended several times, with the last major extension being completed in 2011. Some years after that, the existing Check-in Area of the terminal was closed off from the remainder of the terminal in order to expand the space available in the secure Departure Lounge. Since then, passengers have had to exit the building after checking in and walk along a covered and screened footpath to access the remainder of the terminal including the entry to walk-through security into the Departure Lounge.

Emerald Airport is required to redevelop the terminal building (in line with specific regulatory requirements) to ensure it maintains its Civil Aviation Security Regulator accreditation as a ‘Security Controlled Airport’. In addition, the redevelopment is required to meet Department of Home Affairs Aviation and Maritime Security Division laws and Queensland Fire and Emergency Services regulations and standards. This will ensure continued critical transport services and support of ongoing growth and development to the Central Highlands region.

The following Separable Portions are included in the works:

  1. Terminal Redevelopment Stage 1
  2. Terminal Redevelopment Stage 2
  3. Carpark and Roadway Upgrade Works

For further details, reference should be made to Part 1 - Preamble.

Note the UNSPSC Codes selected and percentage split is arbitrary.

item.title: WRC009739 500.2020.0032 Cannonvale Water Network Augmentation Stages 1A and 1B
item.description:
The Cannonvale water network augmentation Project will consist of the following major components: -

  • Stage 1A
    • Supply and installation of the watermains W-DS1, W-DS4, W-DS5, W-DS6, W-DS7 and W-DS8, including all fittings, fixtures, supports and other ancillary materials:
      • 521m of DN450 PE100 SDR11 PN16 polyethene watermain (W-DS1) from Shute Harbour Road to the Coyne Road reservoir;
      • 467m of DN315 PE100 SDR11 PN16 (W-DS4) polyethene watermain from Duell Road to Coyne Road reservoir (High level pressure zone augmentation).
      • 166m of DN150 M-PVC (W-DS6) pipe connecting Ridge View Road and Tropic Road North; and
      • 32m of D100 M-PVC (W-DS7 and W-DS8) pipe that connects the existing dead ends in Illuka Street and Warruga Street.
  • Stage 1B
    • Supply and installation of the watermains W-DS2 and W-DS3, including all fittings, fixtures, supports and other ancillary materials:
      • 177m DN355 PE100 SDR11 PN16 polyethene watermain (W-DS2) and 358m DN315 PE100 SDR11 PN16 polyethene watermain (W-DS3) from Parkwood Terrace to Hazlewood Crescent, Cannonvale.

item.title: COGC009720 LG314/1211/20/106- DEMOLITION, REMOVAL OF RESTAURANT FITOUT AND REPLACEMENT OF KIRRA PAVILION ROOF
item.description:
The Principal wishes to appoint a suitably experienced, qualified and equipped Contractor to:  
Demolish, remove the restaurant fitout and replace the Kirra Pavilion roof.

With regards to the site inspection please read the following:

If you are intending on coming to the site inpection and you have not registered please ensure that you register by 4pm the day prior and agree to the following.

To those who have registered, I will be in touch shortly as we are planning on splitting the site inspection into two groups (1 @ 8am and 1 @ 9am) to accomodate the latest social distancing protocols.

  • Thursday 26th March 2020 8.00am – 10.00am Queensland time

Location:  Kirra Pavilion – Marine Parade Coolangatta

Please be advised tenderers must adhere to the following requirements for these site inspections:

  • comply with all advice and/or instructions that are given by Health Authorities, State or Federal Government
  • follow good hygiene and social distancing practices (>4metres)
  • Bring along hand sanitiser
  • P3 respirators are to be worn inside the premises as a safety precaution
  • do not attend if you have a cough/cold/flu symptoms and/or
  • you have travelled overseas within the last six weeks.

In addition to the above please note the following:

  • the inspections will be utilised for additional visual inspection of the site only
  • the use of ladders or other platforms are not permitted
  • minimum PPR requirements must be adhered to
  • please note the changes regarding the border restrictions

item.title: MICC009785 Provision of Rate Notices and Associated Services
item.description:
Council is seeking an experienced and capable service provider for the production and distribution of rate and other notices and associated services.

The service will include, but is not limited to:

❖ The supply of DLX and C4 envelopes complete with Council’s return address;

❖ Production and distribution of rates notices in the format approved by Council’s responsible officer;

❖ Production and distribution of water consumption notices in the format approved by Council’s responsible officer;

❖ Production and distribution of water advice notices in the format approved by Council’s responsible officer;

❖ Production and distribution of tip tokens (QR Coded) in the format approved by Council’s responsible officer;

❖ Brochures (as inserts as and when required); and

❖ Production and distribution of Animal Registration renewal Notices.

The successful Tenderer is also required to facilitate the BPAY view function (Payreq) for Council rates and water notices.

item.title: GRC009782 236-20 Design and Construct Tondoon Botanic Gardens Pathway and Bridge
item.description:
Gladstone Regional Council (GRC) is seeking tenders from suitably qualified contractors to design and construct a pedestrian/ light vehicle bridge and construct a pathway, connecting Tondoon Botanic Gardens to the future demonstration gardens over Tondoon Lake.

This tender is for the design and construction of a pedestrian/light vehicle bridge and pathway at Tondoon Botanic Gardens, Gladstone. Works include:

  • Removal and relocation of existing ropes course bridge/post timbers to Tondoon’s Dairy – concrete abutments to be removed and disposed of appropriately (refer to figures in Section 2.12);
  • Removal and relocation of two (2) timber sculptures to Tondoon’s Works Depot – concrete footings to be removed and disposed of appropriately (refer to figures in Section 2.12);
  • Design – Design of pedestrian/light vehicle bridge including abutment / foundation according to the specification provided, geotechnical testing for both the bridge and pathway in accordance with AS 1289.6.1.1 (as a minimum Council would expect 1 x testing at each bridge abutment location and 5 x testing at random locations within pathway alignment, CBR soaked as per AS 1289.6.1.1), earthworks, erosion and sediment control plan and other relevant design documents for approval processes; and
  • Construction – site establishment and preparation, cable and services locating, supply and installation of pedestrian/light vehicle bridge including abutment/foundation as per approved design, earthworks, pathway set out and placement, compaction and concrete testing, site remediation works, ‘as constructed’ drawings in and survey file in both .dwg and .pdf format.

item.title: MBRC009586 After Hours Call Services
item.description: Moreton Bay Regional Council is seeking the services of a suitably qualified supplier in the provision of after-hours call services to members of the public who contact Council outside of normal business hours.

item.title: FCRC009676 CT006 - 19/20 - Hinkler Deal
item.description: The  Fraser  Coast  Regional  Council  (Principal)  lies  within  the  Wide  Bay–Burnett  region  of  Queensland, approximately 250 kilometres north of Brisbane, the state capital. It is centred on the twin cities of Hervey Bay and Maryborough, and also contains Fraser Island. Fraser Coast Region is geographically boundaries can be seen here. The  Fraser  Coast  Regional  Council  has  identified  that  it  is  now  necessary  and  opportunistic  for  the organisation to engage a Program Manager – “Hinkler Deal” To build a better Fraser Coast Community, FCRC has successfully negotiated the Hinkler Deal worth $260 million in total, for upcoming Council’s projects.
